poem:
**The Geography of Words**

In Mayo's embrace,  
a Canadian heart finds refrain.  
Stories unravel like threads,  
weaving Ballina's streets  
into a tapestry of text.  
His wife marvels at the alchemy—  
how his pen dances across the page,  
echoing the lush hum of a place  
he once called home.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Colin Barrett: ‘My wife is astonished that I’m able to write’ Born in Canada in 1982, Colin Barrett was raised near Ballina, County Mayo, and though he left as a teenager, studying creative writing at University College Dublin, Mayo has provided the setting for almost all his writing to date. His debut short story collection, Young Skins, came out in 2013, winning the Guardian first book award and yielding a film adaptation, Calm With Horses,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
